Bhutan: India and Bhutan sign the Treaty of Peace and Friendship, which provided that India would not interfere in Bhutan's internal affairs but that Bhutan would be guided by India in its foreign policy. This is the first international agreement that unambiguously recognizes Bhutan's independence and sovereignty. The same year, India cedes to Bhutan some territories lost to the British in the 1865 Treaty of Sinchula.
